title: Strictly’s Janette Manrara shares tribute to Will Bayley
text:
These two!

After it was confirmed this evening Will Bayley was pulling out of Strictly Come Dancing, his pro dance partner Janette Manrara has shared a heartbreaking tribute.

The Paralympian admitted he was ‘gutted’ to pull out, after he was given a bye through to next week’s competition after jumping off a table and collapsing on his knee.

Viewers saw brief footage of the star coiled over in pain to explain his absence, with his future on the show in doubt.

That was confirmed tonight he would not be returning as Strictly tweeted the sad news along with a statement.

Sharing a sweet shot of the pair with a glitterball trophy, Janette shared her love for Will in a post to Instagram.

‘I had to post this photo again because it represents everything that I feel right now. @willbayleytt will always be my champion!’ she wrote on Wednesday night.

‘He came on this show to share a very special message & every single week through his hard work & determination he did exactly that.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘In my eyes, that is truly winning!

‘You inspired so many & most of all me! Thank you for being so incredible every week & giving your absolute EVERYTHING! I’m sending all the positive energy your way now for a speedy recovery.

Will was later seen leaving It Takes Two after breaking down about his departure (Picture: BACKGRID)

‘And a HUGE thank you to everyone that has supported us & sent such lovely messages! I love you Will, & forever and always….. #WeGotThisChamp ❤️’

Their fellow Strictly stars sent their love after the news was confirmed.

Michelle Visage wrote: ‘WE LOOOOOOOVE YOU @WillBayleytt’, as Kevin Clifton added: ‘Sending all my love to an absolute hero and lovely guy.’

YouTuber Saffron Barker, who is partnered with AJ Pritchard wrote: ‘Absolutely completely gutted for @WillBayleytt & @JManrara.

‘Two of the most genuine and lovely people I’ve ever met! Such an amazing team with so much potential. I will truly miss you so much Will but so glad to have found a friend in you. Get well soon.’

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Dancer Aljaz Skorjanec, who is a pro on the show and is married to Janette said he was ‘gutted’ to see Will have to pull out.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Absolutely gutted that @WillBayleytt and my @JManrara had to pull out of @bbcstrictly,’ he wrote. ‘You had so much more to give Mr.. Hope we see each other on the dancefloor again soon. I wish you a quick recovery.

He added: ‘And my wife… I love you and always here for you #keepdancing.’

Neil Jones wrote: ‘Sad News. @WillBayleytt u made me smile the first moment we met and I know everyone will agree that you have created some very special moments that we will never forget with @JManrara.’

He added his heart ‘goes out to you both and I wish you a speedy and full recovery. you got this Champ.’

The statement from the BBC earlier read: ‘Sadly, due to the injury sustained last week, Will Bayley is leaving Strictly Come Dancing.’

‘I’m gutted my Strictly journey has had to come to an end,’ Will said in the statement.

‘I’ve loved being part of the show, and am so grateful for the phenomenal support we have received. I want to say a special thank you to Janette for believing in me and giving me the confidence to believe in myself. The things we achieved, from our Couple’s Choice dance through to the lifts in our Salsa, will stay with me forever. I’ve had the time of my life.’

Advertisement

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly’s Janette Manrara shares heartbreaking tribute to Will Bayley as he’s forced to quit show.
